awd_titl_txt: The Mechanism of Distribution of Tudor Transcript and       Protein in Oogenesis and Embryogenesis
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this research is to characterize the role of                   tudor, a Drosophila melanogaster maternal effect locus, in two                  central events of early embryogenesis, germ cell determination                  and abdomen segmentation.  The experimental approach is designed                to determine the mechanisms that specify the spatial and temporal               patterns of tudor product distribution during oogenesis and                     embryogenesis.  This will involve: 1) comparison of tudor mRNA                  and protein distribution during germ cell formation and anterior/               posterior axis establishment in wild type and maternal effect                   mutant embryos; 2) determination of the RNA and/or protein                      sequences responsible for localization of tudor products to the                 embryonic posterior pole; and 3) determination whether tudor                    expression is required in late embryogenesis.  Experimental                     objectives will be carried out by introduction and expression of                modified tudor gene constructs in transgenic animals.  These                    studies are expected to contribute to general understanding of                  molecular mechanism(s) of embryonic cell fate determination.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
